Question: 34 year old man after street fight arrived to emergency room suffering from stab wound on anterior chest right to recuts muscle. Which structure mostly affected?
A young man presented by right iliac fossa pain after central pain around umbilicus and diagnosed as appendicitis, why there is pain appears first in the central abdomen?
Option 1: Because appendicitis is swollen, and it contacts both anterior and posterior abdominal walls
Option 2: Because the pain is first conveyed by vagus parasympathetic fibers then somatic fibers in the parietal peritoneum of the abdomen
Option 3: Because the pain first conveyed by sympathetic fibers that enter the spinal cord at T10, then by somatic fibers in the paretal peritoneum in the abdominal walls
Option 4: Because the appendix first irritates the subcostal nerve then the ilioinguinal nerve
Option 5: Because the most sensitive fibers are the afferent sympathetic fibers that enter the spinal cord at T10 then the less sensitive fibres from the lower quadrant abdomen
Correct Answer: Because the pain first conveyed by sympathetic fibers that enter the spinal cord at T10, then by somatic fibers in the paretal peritoneum in the abdominal walls

Question: 23 year old female has admitted to hospital due to acute appendicitis. Which of the following is the site of base of appendix where surgeon made their incision which is called Mcburney point?
Option 1: Point between the two third from the umbilicus and one third from anterior iliac spine
Option 2: Point between the one third from the umbilicus and two third from anterior iliac spine
Option 3: Midpoint between the anterior superior iliac spine and symphysis pubis
Option 4: midpoint between the anterior superior iliac spine and pubic tubercle
Option 5: midpoint between the posterior iliac spine and pubic tubercle
Correct Answer: Point between the two third from the umbilicus and one third from anterior iliac spine

Correct Answer: In the posteriomedial part of the 2nd  part of duodenum
